content:
lass="word-wrap-span">ONE IN lass="word-wrap-span">FIVE girls marries before reaching lass="word-wrap-span">adulthood. lass="word-wrap-span">ONE in twenty is wed before her lass="word-wrap-span">fifteenth birthday. In lass="word-wrap-span">Indlass="word-wrap-span">ONEsia, which has the eighth-lass="word-wrap-span">highest number of child lass="word-wrap-span">brides in the world according to the UN, the phenomenon should soon be a thing of the past. lass="word-wrap-span">This month the country’s parliament raised the minimum age at which girls can marry from 16 to 19. lass="word-wrap-span">Legislators were spurred to act after the lass="word-wrap-span">Constitutional lass="word-wrap-span">Court ruled in December that it was lass="word-wrap-span">discriminatory to mandate a lower minimum age of marriage for girls than for boys.

lass="word-wrap-span">This is good news. lass="word-wrap-span">But on lass="word-wrap-span">This measure, lass="word-wrap-span">Indonesia is by no means the worst offender. lass="word-wrap-span">According to lass="word-wrap-span">UNICEF, the lass="word-wrap-span">United lass="word-wrap-span">Nations’ children’s agency, 14% of lass="word-wrap-span">Indonesian women marry before they reach 18 years old. In lass="word-wrap-span">Bangladesh the figure is 59%; in lass="word-wrap-span">Niger it is 76%. lass="word-wrap-span">Nineteen of the 20 countries where child marriage is most prevalent are in Africa (see map).

lass="word-wrap-span">Families marry off lass="word-wrap-span">Their daughters at a young age in an attempt to make lass="word-wrap-span">Their lives more stable and secure. lass="word-wrap-span">The conditions that tend to be lass="word-wrap-span">associated with lass="word-wrap-span">The practice include rigid gender norms, conflict and poverty. lass="word-wrap-span">Education is perhaps lass="word-wrap-span">The most important factor. A study of 15 countries by lass="word-wrap-span">The lass="word-wrap-span">World lass="word-wrap-span">Bank found that girls without schooling are three times more likely to be married by age 18 than those with secondary lass="word-wrap-span">Education. lass="word-wrap-span">But in many cultures, lass="word-wrap-span">Education for girls comes second to marriage and its lass="word-wrap-span">associated duties.

Cutting a childhood short can have enormous costs. lass="word-wrap-span">Girls who marry have an increased risk of sexual violence, poorer health and higher school drop-out rates. lass="word-wrap-span">They are also less likely to participate in lass="word-wrap-span">The labour force, which has significant economic costs. A paper published in 2015 found that child marriage cost lass="word-wrap-span">Indonesia’s economy 1.7% of GDP in 2014. lass="word-wrap-span">The welfare benefit of ending lass="word-wrap-span">The practice worldwide is lass="word-wrap-span">estimated to be worth around $22bn.

lass="word-wrap-span">Indonesia’s new policy is a big step towards ending child marriage. lass="word-wrap-span">But in the context of lass="word-wrap-span">controversial new revisions to the country’s criminal code—which would criminalise extra-marital sex and lass="word-wrap-span">endorse lass="word-wrap-span">chauvinistic local by-laws—lawmakers will have to lass="word-wrap-span">demonstrate lass="word-wrap-span">That the new marriage age for girls is more than a token gesture towards gender equality. lass="word-wrap-span">Indonesia’s parliament could resolve to tackle the social and economic forces lass="word-wrap-span">That make child marriage so common. Ensuring lass="word-wrap-span">That girls complete their 12 years of lass="word-wrap-span">compulsory schooling would be a start. Reducing unintended pregnancies by improving access to lass="word-wrap-span">contraception and sexual-health education would also help. Giving girls more control over their bodies would allow them to exercise more sway over their future, including who they marry. lass="word-wrap-span">That is worth saying yes to.

ex: n. 协议；协定；一致；和谐
v. 一致；给予；相符；协调

eg2: The two sides signed a peace accord last July.
在刚过去的七月，双方签订了和平条约。
This action would not be in accord with our policy.
这一行动不会符合我们的方针。
This action would not be in accord with our policy.
这一行动不会符合我们的方针。
He came back of his own accord.
他主动回来了。
The symptoms will clear up of their own accord.
症状将会自行消失。
He came back of his own accord.
他主动回来了。
The symptoms will clear up of their own accord.
症状将会自行消失。
Our society accords great importance to the family.
我们的社会赋予家庭十分重要的地位。
Our society accords the family great importance.
我们的社会赋予家庭十分重要的地位。
These results accord closely with our predictions.
这些结果和我们的预测相当一致。

n. 银行；岸；库；河畔

网络 河岸；堤；组
eg2: My salary is paid directly into my bank.
我的工资直接打到我的银行。
I need to go to the bank(= the local office of a bank) .
我得去趟银行。
a bank loan
银行贷款
a bank manager
银行经理
a bank of knowledge
知识宝库
a blood/sperm bank
血库；精子库
He jumped in and swam to the opposite bank.
他跳下水，游到对岸。
It's on the north bank of the Thames.
它位于泰晤士河北岸。
a house on the banks of the River Severn(= on land near the river)
塞文河畔的一所房子
There were low banks of earth between the rice fields.
稻田之间有低矮的田埂。
The girls ran down the steep grassy bank.
女孩子们沿长满青草的陡坡跑下去。
The sun disappeared behind a bank of clouds.
太阳消失在一大片云后面。
a bank of lights/switches/computers
一排灯╱开关╱计算机
She is believed to have banked(= been paid) £10 million in two years.
据信她两年内在银行存了 1 000 万英镑。
The family had banked with Coutts for generations.
那家几代人都在库茨银行存钱。
The plane banked steeply to the left.
飞机向左作高度倾斜飞行。
They banked the earth (up) into a mound.
他们把土堆成了一个土丘。
The fire was banked up as high as if it were midwinter.
炉火被封得很厚实，好像是在隆冬。

eg2: the civil/criminal courts
民事╱刑事法庭
Her lawyer made a statement outside the court.
她的律师在法庭外面发表了一份声明。
She will appear in court tomorrow.
她明天出庭。
They took their landlord to court for breaking the contract.
因为房东毁约，他们把他告上了法庭。
The case took five years to come to court(= to be heard by the court) .
那案件历时五年才被法庭受理。
There wasn't enough evidence to bring the case to court(= start a trial) .
没有足够的证据可把此案提交法庭。
He won the court case and was awarded damages.
他胜诉得到了赔偿金。
She can't pay her tax and is facing court action .
她缴不起税，将面临法庭诉讼。
The case was settled out of court(= a decision was reached without a trial) .
这案件已庭外和解。
Please tell the court what happened.
请向法庭陈述事情的经过。
a tennis/squash/badminton court
网球场；壁球场；羽毛球场
He won after only 52 minutes on court .
他上场仅 52 分钟就赢得了胜利。
the court of Queen Victoria
维多利亚女王的宫廷
the food court at the shopping mall
大型购物中心的食品区
The charges were thrown out of court.
这些指控未予受理。
Well that's my theory ruled out of court.
唉，那就是我遭到摒弃的意见。
The charges were thrown out of court.
这些指控未予受理。
Well that's my theory ruled out of court.
唉，那就是我遭到摒弃的意见。

两位候选人在过去的一个月里都在取悦媒体。
He has never courted popularity.
他从不追求名望。
to court danger/death/disaster
招致危险╱死亡╱灾难
As a politician he has often courted controversy.
作为政治人物，他常常招致争议。
At that time they had been courting for several years.
当时他们已经谈了好几年的恋爱了。

eg2: Whatever befell, we must  as one.
无论发生什么事，我们必须团结一致。
Care must be taken to  with all those that can be united with.
必须注意团结一切可以团结的人。
And whether you voted for me, or you voted for Barack, the time is now to  as a single party with a single purpose.
不管你给我投了票，还是给巴拉克投了票，现在，作为一个党派团结起来，朝同一个目标奋斗的时刻来了。
